qas.question: How many transmitters did CBC intend to upgrade before August 2011?
For what reason did CBC attribute to delayed upgrades?
How many transmitters did CBC plan to upgrade total?
The CBC issued a statement to sell off its assets on what day?
The CRTC agreed to help the CBC install how many transmitters by August 31, 2011?
How many stations did the CBC have broadcasting in analog in 2012?
The CRTC assisted the CBC with the transition due to what reason?

context: On <b3_0>August 6, 2010<b3_0/>, the CBC issued a press release stating that due to <a1_0><b6_0>financial reasons<b6_0/><a1_0/>, the CBC and Radio-Canada would only transition <a2_0>27<a2_0/> transmitters total, one in each market where there was an originating station (i.e. a CBC or Radio-Canada television station located in that market). Further, the CBC stated in the release, that only <a0_0><b4_0>15<b4_0/><a0_0/> of the transmitters would be in place by August 31, 2011 due to lack of available funds, and that the remainder would not be on the air until as late as August 31, 2012. Additionally, the CBC stated in the release that it was asking the CRTC for permission to continue broadcasting in analogue until the identified transmitters for transition were up and running. At the time of the press release, only <b5_0>eight<b5_0/> of the corporation's transmitters (four CBC and four Radio Canada) were broadcasting in digital.
